metadata.title: Invited Commentary on the letter "The COVID-19 crisis: A unique opportunity to expand dermatology to underserved populations."

body_text.text: To the Editor: 1 2 We thank authors Ashrafzadeh and Nambudiri for their response to our article, "Telehealth: 3 Helping your patients and practice survive and thrive during the COVID-19 crisis." Their letter 4 emphasized opportunities and challenges associated with expanding access to underserved 5 populations using teledermatology. We hope that new temporary changes will bring significant attention to the What will telemedicine look like post-COVID-19? A quote attributed to Mahatma Gandhi says, 40 "The true measure of any society can be found in how it treats its most vulnerable members." 41 Likewise, whatever shape telemedicine takes in the future, we must leverage its power to expand 42 access to care to help those who need it most. Indeed, teledermatology is more than technology 43 and infrastructure -it is workflow, collaboration, and partnership. We hope that lessons learned, 44 partnerships built, workflows implemented, and new reimbursement models created during relevant, culturally competent, and community based care.
